result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
1) The defendant will have no further contacts w/law enforcement during term of agrmt. that give rise to probable cause for arrest due to criminal conduct.
2)Defendant shall notify Pepin County District Attorney's Office of any change of residence or employment.
3)Defendant may not possess or consume alcohol or enter into bars or taverns.
4)Defendant must submit to random alcohol testing within 3 hours of the request of the DA and pay all fees associated with testing.....
5)One month prior to completion of this contract, Defendant must contact the District Attorney...
5)Defendant must report in person as requested by the Pepin County District Attorney or other supervisor designated by him.
6 The defendant must follow the rules and regulations as set forth by probation, if applicable.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dalton Tanner Mabrey

records.addlTxt: 22R 000926 - County Attorney Fees Balance owing paid in full.
Proposed Order For Court Appointed Attorney Fees
Letter to Clerk of Court with Court Appointed Attorney Invoice and Order for Fees

01:31 PM Defendant Dalton Tanner Mabrey in court with attorney Allan L Morgan. Prosecuting Atty Jon D. Seifert appeared for State of Wisconsin.   Agreement on count 1 DAGPA, document was signed & filed with the Court.  Court advises defendant of disorderly conduct charge/max. penalties and rights.  Court reviews the DAGP contract with defendant.  Subject to the terms of the contract, to disorderly conduct, defendant pleads no contest.  Court accepts your plea, find you guilty of DC and defer your plea for one year subject to the terms of the contract.  State confirms victim rights have been complied with no further statements.  Mr. Mabrey will be going to treatment in Oshkosh.  Bond applied to county appointed attorney fees with his next payment due 8/1 until Mr. Morgan's fees are paid.
Proposed Deferred Acceptance of Guilty or No Contest Plea Agreement - Signed by parties

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Ordered that Attorney Allan Morgan is appointed to represent the defendant as defense counsel.
Further Ordered That the defendant shall reimburse the County by monthly installments of $100.00 per month commencing 06-01-2022, subsequent payments due the same day of each and every month thereafter.  See Order
Adjourned initial appearance on June 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

01:47 PM Defendant Dalton Tanner Mabrey in court. Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by zoom technology by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of charge/max. penalties and rights.  Mr. Mabrey contacted the PD office and didn't qualify and ask for an attorney.  Court will appoint attorney Allan Morgan and pay $100/mo. com. 6/1 for Mr. Morgan's services.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
